content: I just want to know what are your opinions to this kind of issues that I have. --) I've been in the Navy for 2 years and I got another two years to go. I just got my rate as an OS3 and I felt like my command is screwing me. I got picked up as an alternate for IA. Recently I found out that I have to go IA because one of the Primary person, who volunteer for IA, could not go IA for some reasons... She's getting married and She said her chain of command screwed her because she turned in her leave chit 7 months before her expected time to go IA. Now she didn't want to go. I felt like they're forcing me to go for some stupid reasons and trying to correct the mistakes of my chain of command. I will have to talk to my CO about this because I felt it's unfair. Where is the Equal opportunity in my command? I don't mind going to IRAQ, but I have to stand for what's right. Please free to say your opinions... Thanks OS3

content: Many years ago the ship I was on was at the end of our 6 month cruise. We were about to leave to go home when we were told that our relief ship would be 2 weeks late due to certain cirumstances. It wasn't fair. I did my time. Why did my shipmates and I have to stay out longer than planned? Does it sound like I'm whining?? You're in the military. No one said your life would be fair here. Suck it up and move on. You're not taking a stand for what's right. You're complaining on this forum and lookiing for justification that you're right. Sorry, not from one who did 20 and sucked it up without being viewed as a cryer. You do what you want though. Just don't be surprised if you end up with a label!

content: 190.... equal opportunity? I like that... I was in the Army; in VN there was a valley that the bad guys actually came on our radio net to tell us "don't come here" - well we got the duty so-to-speak..... but we went, and they were waiting... THEY were into equal opportunity, like one here said you're in the military 24/7 365 days.... they shout, you jump, first time every time. Oh, and at your rate and for the rest of your career - bite your tongue - often. Put simply... you don't have to like it, you just have to do it. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: These days it is almost a guarantee that if you are in the Navy you will do an IA or a TDY to some place. Everyone is doing them to places all over the place including Afghanistan, Iraq, Kuwait, Djibouti. Have a friend whose dh is in Qatar right now he is an officer. Two former female shipmates of my dh went to Afghanistan they were both OS's. Another friend went to Djibouti, someone else to Bahrain, and the list continues. This includes everyone at every command whether surface, submarines or shore. There is nothing you can really do except start packing your bags to go.

content: quote: Originally posted by 67NOV: What's "IA"? Individual Augmentee with the Navy. You can be sent anywhere necessary from a few weeks to over a year. Normally these days it is to Djibouti, Iraq, Afghanistan, Qatar, Bahrain, Kuwait, in other words Africa & Middle East areas. It can be to another branch's unit. For example friend is a RP (Chaplain's Assistant) he was stationed in Oklahoma and went IA to Iraq for 8 months and was with an Army Unit. Another friend is an OS she went to Afghanistan for 6 months.
